title: Robert Hawkins (Northwest Territories politician)
text:
Robert Hawkins is an engineering technologist and a former municipal and territorial level politician from <a href="Northwest%20Territories">Northwest Territories</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a>.
Early life.
Hawkins moved to Fort Simpson, Northwest Territories in 1977 as a child. Hawkins moved to <a href="Yellowknife">Yellowknife</a>, <a href="Northwest%20Territories">Northwest Territories</a> in 1987 to begin schooling at Sir John Franklin High School. He attended his post secondary education at <a href="SAIT%20Polytechnic">SAIT Polytechnic</a> in <a href="Calgary">Calgary</a>, <a href="Alberta">Alberta</a>. He began his political career when he was elected as a city councillor for <a href="Yellowknife%20City%20Council">Yellowknife City Council</a>. He held that post until 2003 when he sought election to the territorial legislature.
Political career.
Hawkins was first elected to the Northwest Territories Legislature winning the <a href="Yellowknife%20Centre">Yellowknife Centre</a> electoral district in the <a href="2003%20Northwest%20Territories%20general%20election">2003 Northwest Territories general election</a>. He defeated 6 other candidates to take the sought after seat. In 2007, Hawkins pursued re-election and won again with almost 50% of the popular vote, and approximately 20% more than his closest competitor. <a href="2007%20Northwest%20Territories%20general%20election">2007 Northwest Territories general election</a>.
